definition: the new moon/the first day of the lunar month
beginning/first day of lunar month/north
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]
spring tide (biggest tide, at new moon or full moon)

sentences.english: At these times the earth experiences its highest tides, commonly known as spring tides.
sentences.chinese: 在这两个时期，地球出现最大的潮汐，通常称为朔望。

sentences.english: It is a basic fact that earthquake occurrence can be modulated and triggered by the syzygial tide.
sentences.chinese: 朔望潮触发和调制地震的发生已是一个基本事实。

definition: first day of the lunar month
the first day of each month
the full moon/the fifteenth day of each lunar month

pair of annual sacrificial ceremonies held by the emperor in ancient times: one in the southern suburbs of the capital (bringing offerings to Heaven) and another in the northern suburbs (with offerings to Earth)
to fast
old calendar/the Chinese lunar calendar/same as 農曆|农历[nong2 li4]

usual practice/routine
festive season/happy time/noble principle
to call (at sb's home) personally
fasting days/a fast
to offer sacrifices (to gods or ancestors) whilst abstaining from meat, wine etc

to offer sacrifices to the gods
